item.title: Desert Strike spiritual successor Cleared Hot's next update brings better Steam Deck support and arcade missions, but I'm more excited about using my winch to slingshot missiles back at enemies: 'I've been waiting months to work on this again'
item.content:encoded: Blowback.

item.title: Tactical Breach Wizards sold 'twice as well' as Suspicious Developments' previous games, but more importantly, it failed catastrophically to lose an IGF award: 'All we can say is we're sorry, and we'll try to do worse'
item.content:encoded: "We weren't able to lose the IGF award for Excellence in Design."

item.title: Stardew Valley has basically become the Tolkien of cozy gaming
item.content:encoded: A decade after launch, Stardew Valley is still the de facto starting point and fondest farm sim for so many cozy gamers.

item.title: Finally, you can play Metal Gear Solid 5: Ground Zeroes inside Metal Gear Solid 5: The Phantom Pain thanks to this mod
item.content:encoded: Limb reattachment.

item.title: Should you destroy or release Elpis in Resident Evil Requiem?
item.content:encoded: Decisions, decisions.

item.title: Occult deckbuilder The Killing Stone is introducing a 'dynamic' scare system originally considered for BioShock 2: 'It's very fun as a gamedev to be surprised by something in your own game'
item.content:encoded: "That idea has stuck around in my brain."

item.title: Markiplier says Hollywood was 'willfully ignoring the potential of YouTubers' before his film Iron Lung made $50 million at the box office
item.content:encoded: "No one was really bashing down my door to say, 'We want to make your movie!'" the actor and director of the indie horror film said.

item.title: After deciding to make a MOBA, Quantic Dream also decides to release it at the same time as the Marathon server slam, the first Horizon Hunters Gather playtest, and the Steam Next Fest
item.content:encoded: You know how some studios delayed their games to avoid Cyberpunk 2077 and Grand Theft Auto 6? Quantic Dream is doing the completely opposite thing.

item.title: Sony was ready to approve a Bloodborne remake, but FromSoftware turned it down
item.content:encoded: The chances of it happening are now at their lowest.

item.title: If you love Marathon's vectorheart style but not its PvP, get your aesthetic fix from the gorgeously overstimulating demo for this time trial FPS instead
item.content:encoded: Tear flesh from bone.

item.title: Is Marathon's time-to-kill too fast, or am I too Arc Raiders-pilled?
item.content:encoded: I'm finally embracing what Marathon is actually going for.

item.title: I went on a serious cottagecore Stardew Valley mod hunt and now I've got the cozy farm of my dreams for my next save
item.content:encoded: Paint the town green with a curated list of Stardew Valley downloads.

item.title: Marathon Server Slam update: Bungie says if you're not getting enough PvP action, maybe you're just not looking for fights in the right places
item.content:encoded: Bungie shared a quick rundown of how things are going, and where it aims to go from here.

item.title: A medieval MMO that shut down in 2023 after 6 years of early access and less than 1 year of full release is making a surprise comeback
item.content:encoded: Gloria Victis is being resurrected under new ownership as a free-to-play game.

item.title: Steam Next Fest's top demos were packed with gnomeslop hijinks, open world piracy, and vampire card battling, but then—well—Marathon happened
item.content:encoded: Oh, and cowboy robot wizards. Can't forget those.

item.title: Space Marine 2 adds a new free class, the Techmarine—an engineer with the unbeatable combo of an automated sentry turret and a gigantic axe
item.content:encoded: Plus a new PvE mission.

item.title: The Muri: Wildwoods demo blends cute critters and the same satisfaction of PowerWash Simulator to create what might be my favourite demo from Steam Next Fest
item.content:encoded: Cleanse the world and, in turn, your soul.

item.title: Phanteks XT V3 case review
item.content:encoded: Don’t call it a comeback.

item.title: Microsoft's update for Direct3D, with opacity micromaps and shader execution reordering now official features, will probably mean little to gamers but graphics devs are going to be happy
item.content:encoded: And happy devs mean better games, right? Right??

item.title: In a sea of needlessly long videogames, Resident Evil Requiem proves that 10 hours is all you need if you're able to make every second count
item.content:encoded: Too much of a good thing, and all that.

item.title: ThunderX3 Solo 360 review
item.content:encoded: Simply the best budget gaming chair I've had the pleasure to perch upon.

item.title: ConcernedApe finds out not everyone will be hot for the blacksmith in Stardew Valley's upcoming 1.7 update: 'You've all been dying to marry Clint... right? ...guys?'
item.content:encoded: He's not my first choice either, but some of you are just being mean.

item.title: DeepSeek has reportedly denied Nvidia and AMD early access to its new V4 AI model, giving Huawei and other Chinese chipmakers a head start
item.content:encoded: The AI race turns another corner.

item.title: Bingo Betty is the new Balatro-like to top my Steam Library with its wacky items and mesmerising Mega Bingo chains
item.content:encoded: And that's a bingo.

item.title: OpenAI announces another $110 billion in investment funding including $30 billion from Nvidia, but says Microsoft is still its best friend forever
item.content:encoded: Aww. Isn't it sweet when multi-billion, sometimes multi-trillion dollar businesses buddy up?

item.title: PS5 Pro owners will soon get an improved PSSR AI upscaler, while PC gamers with RDNA 2 and 3 GPUs are still praying for AMD to add official support for FSR 4
item.content:encoded: All these GPUs share very similar parts and features, so if one can do AI upscaling, why can't they all?

item.title: The first look at Amazon's God of War TV show dares to ask: What if dadbod Kratos?
item.content:encoded: Clean dadbod Kratos, no less.

item.title: MSI MEG X870E Ace Max review
item.content:encoded: Bigger BIOS, better overclocking.

item.title: MSI MAG B850 Gaming Plus Max WiFi review
item.content:encoded: Bigger BIOS, better overclocking.

item.title: How to open the triple-locked safebox in WoW Midnight
item.content:encoded: Get some loot and progress the Treasures of Eversong achievement.

item.title: Wooting 60HE v2 review
item.content:encoded: Its best yet.

item.title: Balatro meets Scrabble in this new roguelike from the creators of TimeSplitters—and I'm just thrilled to finally find a word game that lets me score with swear words
item.content:encoded: Beyond Words finds the perfect balance between synergy and spelling.

item.title: A new California law says all operating systems, including Linux, need to have some form of age verification at account setup
item.content:encoded: I wonder how the government of California plans to enforce it?

item.title: Resident Evil Requiem's path tracing is tough on GPUs but it probably won't take as long as ray tracing did to become a mainstream option in games
item.content:encoded: Ray tracing? Pffft, easy peasy now.

item.title: Intel Foundry exec leaves to head up Qualcomm's semiconductor biz as Intel shake-up continues
item.content:encoded: Intel has lost a few key execs over the past 18 months.

item.title: 'An absolute eyesore': Marathon's biggest issue seems to be its poor UI design that's confusing players, 'I have no idea where I'm at, what I'm looking at'
item.content:encoded: And now the kids are calling it fontslop.

item.title: Sony looks to be 'backing away from putting their exclusive console stuff on PC,' says Bloomberg's Jason Schreier
item.content:encoded: Time to hoard your Nixxes ports like nuts for winter.

item.title: Anthropic is standing up to the US Department of War and refusing to remove AI autonomous weapon and mass surveillance safeguards: 'We cannot in good conscience accede to their request'
item.content:encoded: 'We will not knowingly provide a product that puts America’s warfighters and civilians at risk.'

item.title: Nvidia releases then unreleases GeForce 595.59 drivers as reports of graphics card fan outages and clock speed issues pour in
item.content:encoded: Here's hoping it's fixed before the Marathon Server Slam ends.

item.title: 'The Light really did call EVERYBODY': players find Leeory Jenkins, complete with his cloth shoulderpads, defending the Sunwell in World of Warcraft: Midnight
item.content:encoded: Those shoulders'll help him heal better, he'll have more mana.

item.title: The massive difference between how well Resident Evil Requiem runs on the Steam Deck and an Asus ROG Ally just adds more fuel to the rumour that AMD has abandoned driver support for its Ryzen Z1 chips
item.content:encoded: And if that really is the case, how long before it does the same with Z2 processors?

item.title: Resident Evil Requiem pulls in 270,000 players in just 2 hours on Steam, beating Village, Biohazard and the Resident Evil 4 remake
item.content:encoded: That's the pull of Leon S Kennedy.

item.title: Capcom's RE Engine is the gift that keeps on giving: Resident Evil Requiem runs surprisingly well on the Steam Deck
item.content:encoded: I didn't expect a big budget 2026 game to be this playable on the Deck.

item.title: Fallout 76 adjusted roughly 50 events and activities for the latest free update, with more XP for higher levels and shorter timers: 'We tried to concentrate on the broad strokes'
item.content:encoded: Events and activities have had a facelift.

item.title: Famed for its 100+ hour anime tactics RPGs, the Disgaea series is getting an action-centric spin-off
item.content:encoded: Kyouran Makaism released in Japan last month, but will come to the west as Disgaea Mayhem.

item.title: Valve's former economist, now a member of parliament in Greece, is being put on trial for promoting drug use because he admitted to taking ecstasy 36 years ago
item.content:encoded: He's come a long way from analyzing TF2 hat sales data.

item.title: Resident Evil Requiem guide: Puzzle solutions, locked doors, collectibles, and more
item.content:encoded: All the RE Requiem help you need in one place.

item.title: An AI-generated review of Resident Evil Requiem written by a fake 'iGaming and sports betting analyst' briefly hit Metacritic
item.content:encoded: The site responsible laid off its real editorial staff only weeks ago.

item.title: If you're hoping to make friends in Marathon like you can in Arc Raiders, expect a knife in the back
item.content:encoded: In my experience, shoot first.

item.title: The next Lego Batman recreates a memorable scene from the 1989 movie, complete with Prince soundtrack
item.content:encoded: It's a party, man.
